Package fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter

Class MonoJVMHomogeneousDataCenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
      • fr.sorbonne_u.datacenter.MonoJVMHomogeneousDataCenter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.ComponentVirtualMachineI
    public class MonoJVMHomogeneousDataCenter
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.cvm.AbstractCVM
    The class MonoJVMDataCenter defines the basis of a simulated data center deployed as a component-based simulation in a single JVM.

    Description

    Invariant 

     invariant              true

    Created on : August 26, 2015

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonoJVMHomogeneousDataCenter

        public MonoJVMHomogeneousDataCenter​(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> admissibleFrequencies,
                                    int defaultFrequency,
                                    int maxFrequencyGap,
                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> processingPower)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        create a set of computers in a simulated data center.

        Contract 

         pre    true                    // no precondition.
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        admissibleFrequencies - set of admissible frequencies for processors cores.
        defaultFrequency - default frequency of processors cores.
        maxFrequencyGap - maximum difference in frequencies among cores of the same processor.
        processingPower - map defining the relationship between the frequency of a core and the number of instructions per second the core can process.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
